sentences.english: Dutch coach Bert Van Marwijk was gracious in defeat.
sentences.chinese: 对于失利，荷兰队教练伯特范马尔维克显得很坦然。

sentences.english: Humiliated England loses out again, refuses to congratulate Russia.
sentences.chinese: 英国申办世界杯失利给赢家俄罗斯冷脸。

sentences.english: A heart-broken loss, get Rafer out the town, everybody hates you.
sentences.chinese: 一场心碎的失利，斯通滚出休城，每个人都讨厌你。

sentences.english: We must face the fact that we might lose the game .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须正视我们恳比赛失利这一事实。

sentences.english: Even if you fail in the interview, don't take it serious.
sentences.chinese: 即使面试一时失利，也不要以一次失败论英雄。

sentences.english: France surrendered after the fall of Diên Biên Phu in 1954.
sentences.chinese: 1954年在奠边府战役中失利后法国最终投降。

sentences.english: We live under circumstances where every defeat is an absolutely a disgrace and an earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 我们的生存状况是，每次的失利都是耻辱和冲击。

sentences.english: Buy flowers, she is at it again, she happily between two people.
sentences.chinese: 买花失利，周母再出新招，她乐此不疲地撮合两人。

sentences.english: If you missed out, are you considering a charity entry?
sentences.chinese: 如果你失利了，你考虑参加慈善的入场赛吗？

sentences.english: His miscalculation about what voters want made him lose the election.
sentences.chinese: 他对选民需求的错估让他的选举失利。

sentences.english: Maybe that’s why Chongqing Blues failed.
sentences.chinese: 也许这正是《日照重庆》影展失利的原因。

sentences.english: Abe quit after one year in office after an election rout.
sentences.chinese: 安倍任职一年后便在一次选举失利后辞职。

sentences.english: 8226; He ran for the Vice-presidential nomination in 1856, and lost that too.
sentences.chinese: 1856年，他竞选副总统候选人提名，也告失利。

sentences.english: Accepting singleness is a victory, not a defeat.
sentences.chinese: 去接受单身是一种胜利，而非一场失利。

sentences.english: Some believed that it was the fans' shouting that was to blame for Li's loss.
sentences.chinese: 一些人认为，李的失利应归咎于观众的呼喊。

sentences.english: Jarred for the first time with playoff desperation, those beautiful passes were junked.
sentences.chinese: 面对季后赛的首次失利，美好的时光已经过去。

definition: (literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
to lose to (sb)/to be outdone by
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
to be utterly defeated/to be routed
consecutive defeats/to lose several times in a row
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
